description.narrative: This project aims to support the implementation of the Child Development Grant Programme (CDGP) in the targeted areas of Nigeria.

mailing-address.narrative: 1 Saint Johns Lane, London EC1M 4AR, United Kingdom

title.narrative: NGA Child Development Grant Programme (CDGP), Northern Nigeria

description.narrative: A scalable programme showing how cash transfers can bring cost-effective immediate and long-term food security and nutrition benefits to eligible households with young children in poor communities in northern Nigeria
% of children 0-6 months who are exclusively breastfed in CDGP communities
Proportion of children 6-23 months of age who receive foods from 4 or more food groups in CDGP communities.
% of households who borrowed money in the past one year to cope with insufficient food availability in CDGP communities
Status of federal and state policies and approval of plan for non-contributory social protection

comment.narrative: No approved SP policy or plan at the federal or state level
Federal and State Social Protection Policy integrated into National and State Development Plans and MTEF
Jigawa, Zamfara and national SP policies developed. Jigawa and national SP policies approved. Budget provided in both Jigawa and Zamfara for SP.

description.narrative: Design and delivery of government led inclusive social protection programmes is informed by a sound evidence base
# of government staff trained on social protection/ cash transfer programme management, integration social inclusion issues

# of programme and states with functional beneficiary feedback mechanisms that fully consider and respond to needs of different social groups especially marginalised groups in focal states and federal
Framework, manual and guidelines developed or review for NASSP to guide an effective and inclusive SP programme implementation

comment.narrative: Assessment report with clear recommendation of priorities areas
Social Inclusion assessment commissioned and underway

description.narrative: Effective system for mobilising, targeting and delivering complementary interventions established.
Percentage of community volunteers trained on IYCF that passed IYCF training, obtaining 70% and above in post training evaluation test.
% of active beneficiaries participating in IYCF group sessions (T2 communities only)
% of active beneficiaries receiving 1:1 counseling (T2 communities only)
% of pregnant and lactating women with improved health & nutrition practices (T1 & T2)
% of pregnant/lactating or both women demonstrating adequate knowledge on key health and nutrition messages (T1 & T2)
Resolved complaints as a % of total reported complaints in all categories
Total number of beneficiaries reached with SBCC nutrition awareness sessions
Enhanced federal and state level enagement in cash transfers led to enhanced capacity of federal and states staekholders in child poverty and survival by 2019

Number of MDAs at the federal and state levels provided with technical support (strenghtened systems) to deliver social protection and child and nutrition sensitive social protection programmes/interventions.
Number of active champions and change agents for social protection and child and nutrition-sensitive social protection issues at the state and federal level
State government contribution (in cash and kind) as a percentage of programme implementation cost.
Number of government staff trained on social protection and child and nutrition-sensitive social protection
Number of approved Social Protection policies and plans sensitive to key child and nutrition-sensitive social protection issues.

comment.narrative: No social protection policies in place

description.narrative: Evidence of cash transfer modalities and impacts used by policymakers and practitioners at State and Federal levels
Number of cases studies, technical and policy briefs (including operational notes and short learning papers) produced to inform the design of NASSP

comment.narrative: 10 total = 8 case studies, 1 programme brief and 1 technical brief
38 total = 24 case studies, 10 video success stories and 2 technical briefs ( 1 PDM and 1 programme brochure)

description.narrative: Number of disseminations through different channels to key stakeholders at local and international level

comment.narrative: 2 dissemination meetings held with state and federal stakeholders

description.narrative: Number of key components of CDGP adopted/adapted by governments.

comment.narrative: At least 3 components of the CDGP is adopted/adapted by governments

description.narrative: Number of recommendations from research, evaluations, assessments and annual reviews that influence changes in programme implementation

comment.narrative: 2 dissemination meetings held with state and federal stakeholders
1 dissemination of the baseline benchmarks at state level
Lessons from pilot incorporated into rollout plan & 2 PDM
2 PDM; 2 learning workshops and 1 revision of implementation manual
2 dissemination meetings held with state and federal stakeholders

description.narrative: Improved enabling environment for social protection through strengthened policies, legislation and institutions at state and federal level.
# of functional social protection co-ordination mechanisms at federal and focal states

comment.narrative:
4 clearly established coordination committees with ToRs and joint action plans for SP in 4 project states.
Draft Coordinating approach at FG for SP Delivery

Four Coordination committees in place across 4 focal states, meeting according to agreed timelines and implementation of action plan ongoing
Federal SP TWG in place and currently leading the review of the National Social protection policy and the development of a social protection bill

description.narrative: # of legal instruments (federal& focal States) that address Social protection or integrate social protection into law, that are endorsed by stakeholders for sharing with Parliament

comment.narrative:
Comparative analysis of SP legal frameworks in Africa undertaken.
Dialogue at federal level on legal framework for Nigeria.
Draft Legal Instrument in 1 focal state.

SP Bills for 3 states developed, Jigawa, Kaduna and Zamfara, the bill for the FG has been drafted, the Comparative analysis of SP legal frameworks in Africa finalized and the relevant findings incorporated in the bill development.

description.narrative: Institutional framework for social protection designed and endorsed

comment.narrative:
At least 2 State Road maps to deliver on SP institutional framework
Dialogue on SP institutional framework at fedral level
Strategies/ plan in 4 States, while SP policy for Federal under review

description.narrative: Social protection policies with specific measures and plans to address key vulnerabilities across the life cycle are in place in focal states
Improved nutritional status of children under five in Jigawa and Zamfara states
82600536 Logframe
Prevalence of stunting among under-5s in CDGP communities
Increased coverage of government funded inclusive and accountable social protection programmes and interventions
% of extreme poor covered by Social Assistance programmes, in focal States and Nationally
Proportion of focal States with functional mechanisms for accountable implementation of SP policies and programmes

comment.narrative: 4 Focal states Coordinating mechanisms have been established with clear ToRs that include civil society participation, meetings according to timeframes set in the TOR and follow up of actions and feedback from the action points of their meetings

description.narrative: Proportion of focal and Nigerian states government SP programmes that incorporate SP models influenced by CDGP to support the effective implementation of social protection
Increased political will, public awareness and accountability for social protection at state and federal level.
# of active civil society platforms operating at national and focal states level, focused on promoting social protection and influencing government progress on SP commitments.
# of active individual civil society organisation at state and Federal Level promoting and Advocating for inclusive SP.
# of civil society organizations at federal and state level capacity built on inclusive and accountable social protection

comment.narrative: (4 in states and 1 Federal) Platforms in place

description.narrative: # of inclusive social protection sensitive reporting, and media mention of Government actions supported by CDGP programme activities in line with programme outputs, by the media.
# of media reporters (print and electronic and social media) trained on inclusive social protection
# of project states with civil society and community mechanisms routinely engaging with local and national decision makers, to deliver direct feedback on social protection programme delivery
Nigerian citizens, including children, experience reduced multi-dimensional poverty
% of population living below the extreme poverty line
Secure payments mechanism providing regular, timely cash transfers to pregnant women and women with under-2s
% of Traditional Wards covered in targeted villages
% of active beneficiaries receiving correct transfer amounts within 10 days of approval days on a monthly basis.
% of beneficiaries satisfied with the transparency and ease of Payment mechanism
% of community members satisfied with transparency of targeting and enrollment mechanism
% of matured exited beneficaries satisfied with the exit process
